title: Verify that the Search with a combination of package and patron and user is working fine.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PV application.
2. Navigate to Ticketing - Ticket Services.
3. Click on Advanced Search.
4. Enter Package field detail along with Patron/User
5. Select delivery option button
6. Click on Find.
7. Verify the displayed results.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Logged into PV application successfully.
2. Ticket Services page loaded properly.
3. Advanced Search screen loaded successfully with all UI contents properly.
4. Patron/User details should be entered 
successfully.
5. Delivery option should be selected successfully.
6. Results should be displayed based on the 
search criteria.
7. Make sure that the package details should be 
displayed based on the search criteria.

title: Verify the search result has any missing orders while performing an advanced search

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Under Application Properties, set max.order.search.results to 5.
Set default.transaction.date.search.past.days to 365.
2. Navigate to Ticket Services
3. Select patron search criteria and enter a search value.
Click Find button.
Note down the 5 orders returned.
4. Navigate to Application Properties, set max.order.search.results to 20.
5. Navigate to Ticket Services
6. Select patron search criteria under Advanced search and enter a search value.
Click Find button.
7. Verify whether the 5 order noted are displayed in the current top search results.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. The pre-condition is set
2. User is navigated to ticket services
3. Order search results are returned.
The Orders are noted.
4. The property value is set.
5. User is navigated to ticket services
6. Order search results are returned.
7. The 5 order noted must be displayed in the current top search results.
No additional orders must be displayed

title: Verify the Delivery ID results returned when searched with Patron, Card# and Sale Type Search criteria for an advanced search where Default Date range setting is having value greater than 365.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. PreCondition: 
1. Set the value of the new date range setting under Application Properties to value greater than 365.
2.  Complete an order transaction with card.
3 .Set the  property "max.order.search.results"  under Application Properties to a lower value( for eg. 5) 
4. Select search criteria such that it has orders greater than maximum limit set. (for eg. 20 orders).
2. Navigate to Ticket Services portal
3. Select Advanced Search.
4. Set the Option as 'Transaction' under Order Search tab
5. Type the Patron, Card# and Sale Type used in precondition as the search value and click Find button.
Verify the Delivery ID results returned.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 1. The date range value should be successfully set to value greater than 365.
2. The order transaction must be completed successfully.
3. The property "max.order.search.results" should be set to a lower value
 4. The search criteria selected should have orders greater than maximum limit set.
2. System should navigate to Ticket Services portal
3. Advanced Search view must be shown.
4. Transaction option must be successfully selected.
5. 1. The Delivery ID  results should display transactions between the date range based on the setting value given under Application properties.
2. The Delivery ID results should display the most recently done transaction at the top and in reverse chronoligical order.

1. Set the value of the new date range setting under Application Properties to value greater than 365.
2.  Complete an order transaction with a card#.
3 .Set the  property "max.order.search.results"  under Application Properties to a lower value( for eg. 5) 
4. Select search criteria such that it has orders greater than maximum limit set. (for eg. 20 orders).
2. Navigate to Ticket Services portal
3. Select Advanced Search.
4. Set the Option as 'Transaction' under Order Search tab
5. Type the Patron, Card#,  Sale Type and Event used in precondition as the search value and click Find button.
Verify the Transaction ID results returned.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 1. The date range value should be successfully set to value greater than 365.
2. The order transaction must be completed successfully.
3. The property "max.order.search.results" should be set to a lower value
 4. The search criteria selected should have orders greater than maximum limit set.
2. System should navigate to Ticket Services portal
3. Advanced Search view must be shown.
4. Transaction option must be successfully selected.
5. 1. The Transaction ID  results should display transactions between the date range based on the setting value given under Application properties.
2. The Transaction ID results should display the most recently done transaction at the top and in reverse chronoligical order.

title: Verify the search result has any missing orders while performing a simple search

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Under Application Properties, set max.order.search.results to 5.
Set default.transaction.date.search.past.days to 365.
2. Navigate to Ticket Services
3. Select patron search criteria and enter a search value.
Click Find button.
Note down the 5 orders returned.
4. Navigate to Application Properties, set max.order.search.results to 20.
5. Navigate to Ticket Services
6. Select patron search criteria and enter a search value.
Click Find button.
7. Verify whether the 5 order noted are displayed in the current top search results.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. The pre-condition is set
2. User is navigated to ticket services
3. Order search results are returned.
The Orders are noted.
4. The property value is set.
5. User is navigated to ticket services
6. Order search results are returned.
7. The 5 order noted must be displayed in the current top search results.
No additional orders must be displayed

title: Verify the Transaction ID results returned when searched with Delivery Info field Search criteria for a simple search where Default Date range setting is having value lesser than 365.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. PreCondition: 
1. Set the value of the new date range setting under Application Properties to value lesser than 365.
2.  Complete an order transaction.
3 .Set the  property "max.transaction.search.results"  under Application Properties to a lower value( for eg. 5) 
4. Select search criteria such that it has orders greater than maximum limit set. (for eg. 20 orders).
2. Navigate to Ticket Services portal
3. Select the search criteria as Delivery Info under Order Search tab
4. Set the Option as 'Transaction' under Order Search tab
5. Type the Delivery Info used in precondition as the search value and click Find button.
Verify the Transaction Id results returned.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 1. The date range value should be successfully set to value lesser than 365.
2. The order transaction must be completed successfully.
3. The property "max.transaction.search.results" should be set to a lower value
 4. The search criteria selected should have orders greater than maximum limit set.
2. System should navigate to Ticket Services portal
3. Delivery Info search criteria must be successfully selected.
4. Transaction option must be successfully selected.
5. 1. The Transaction ID  results should display transactions between the date range based on the setting value given under Application properties.
2. The Transaction ID results should display the most recently done transaction at the top and in reverse chronoligical order.
